title: Andrew Cuomo Sex-Crime Charge Dismissed by Albany Judge
sub_head: District attorney said he didn’t have enough evidence to meet burden of proof in forcible touching allegation against ex-governor
body:
ALBANY, N.Y.—A judge dismissed a misdemeanor sex-crime charge against former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo on Friday after prosecutors said they were unable to move forward with the case.
The Democratic former governor was charged in October with forcible touching in connection with a 2020 incident in which his then-executive assistant, Brittany Commisso, said he groped her breast at the Executive Mansion. Mr. Cuomo has denied Ms. Commisso’s account.
